transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. It has been losing people because it is not very accepting.
They have strong views on things like same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
Some people do not agree with these views. They think the Church should consider new ideas.
The Church is against abortion. If you believe in it, you might not feel comfortable.
The same is true for same-sex marriage. If you believe in it, you might not feel right in a Church that does not agree.
I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests.
But I do not think these changes would have stopped people from leaving.
Many people like the idea of priests being married. It would be like their job and family life.

I think people are born gay, not choose it. So, I agree with same-sex marriage. I do not believe the federal government should interfere. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is about people's personal lives. I think the government should not make rules about this. It is wrong to punish people for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to traditional families.
But it is different.
There are many aspects to it.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Heads will not be tails.
But it is the same thing.
And there are many civil rights connected with it, like property taxes and health care.
If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be with you if you are sick.
They cannot visit you.
Because they are not legally your family.
I think this is silly if you are going to spend your life with someone.
Many scientific studies show that homosexual couples are just as successful as heterosexual couples.
It is just a relationship.
It is the same thing.
And many people get hung up on things like church involvement.
Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church.
They are asking for a marriage certificate.
If there is no church involvement, this should not be a problem.
I cannot understand why Catholics get hung up on this.
In a legal sense, if you are allowed a civil union, why not a marriage?
It is like segregation: separate but unequal.
They are the same in many ways, like relationships and community involvement.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will adjust to society.
But again, it is hard to know for sure.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
I think the amendment should say the opposite.
But President Bush has strong views on this.
He believes it goes with his views on abortion and stem cell research.
Most reasons I hear are moral reasons.
Morality differs from person to person.
To embrace one group's morality while ignoring others is unethical.
To make a law based on religious beliefs is hypocritical, considering recent controversies.
Many people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are damaged.
This is not true, according to the American Psychological Association.
People should listen to real research, not just popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal but have beneficial properties. I think it is not good to keep them away from people. I think it is okay to use them for medicine.

There are many illegal drugs that we use in pharmacies. Like oxycodone, vicodin, and perocet. These are controlled substances, but they help people. So we should not deny the good things because of a taboo around marijuana.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If people abuse alcohol, it can lead to bad things. But marijuana is less harmful than heroine or cocaine.

I think we should first remove the bad image people have of marijuana. Then people might use it responsibly. And we can make it legal gradually, not all at once.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday in a cute little dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that lasts only thirty minutes. People dress more casually, especially during summer when people come in beach clothes. Even during morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. The church I know does not involve much politics. I think these changes do not affect the accusations against Catholic priests. I do not think the church could have stopped these issues. Even if priests could marry, some men have pedophilia because of genetics, not because they are married or not married. I think the church could have done more to prevent cover-ups. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Many people were upset after September 11th. Some felt that the Iraq war was a mistake. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true. This made people angry. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. This was like a crime. Colin Powell, who was a helper to the president, later said he was not sure about the evidence he gave to the United Nations. This made people very angry. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. Some people think they wanted to get more oil. The war has been going on a long time. Withdrawing might cause more problems. Civil war might start. Some people think other countries can help. But this might not help in the long term. The Iraq government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. The country is very divided. It is hard to fix the problem.

I don't feel good about the War in Iraq. It started because we thought Iraq did something. Maybe they bombed the U.S. Maybe they were behind the 9/11 attacks. I don't know the details. I don't like it. I think we're there to create democracy and get oil. But people are upset. It's hard to help them quickly. If we leave, they'll be angry. If we stay, they might hate us more. I think it's a problem. It's hard to say if it should continue. I feel bad for Bush. He looks bad. It's like the Vietnam War. It might never end. I don't want to see kids hurt. But they have different cultures. If we stay, it might make it worse. I think it will go on for a long time.

I do not think it is right for a law to be made or for a state to make it illegal. The constitution says separation of church and state. I think this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. It is clear in the constitution that churches should make the rules for themselves. Trying to make a law for this would go against the constitution. This is not the first time this has happened, and it will not be the last. I do not believe the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. This is a personal belief issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because he is a Catholic and wants it to be against his personal beliefs. It is not a good idea to make a law for this issue because it could affect the economy or society in a bad way.

The war in Iraq. Many people think the government did not tell the truth about why they wanted to invade Iraq. They said it was to stop terrorists connected to the attacks of September 11th, but this was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about 9/11 and start the war in 2003.

I am against war. Especially when it is a surprise attack. The government should have learned from the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died there, and the government was not ready for what happened after removing the government.

The government should have planned for all possible results. They did not. Many American soldiers are still dying, and the Iraqis need help to run their country. It is hard to make a new government. It took a long time in our own country.

In the election, I thought George Bush should finish what he started. But many American soldiers are dying. We need to think about when is enough enough. Why only Iraq? It might be about oil.

Let's hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I believe it is a personal choice. People should not be denied rights because of their biological makeup. It is unfair and inhumane. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage. I think politics and government should not interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live just like any other family. They are not married because they are not allowed to be. I think it is ridiculous that Bush wants to interpret marriage his own way. I believe that being gay is often biological, not sociological. People are born this way, not because of their upbringing. I think if a couple wants to marry, it should be a private, not public, matter.

When you put things on the internet, they can be seen by anyone. It is a public place. As an R.A., I have dealt with this. When someone posts about dangerous things, the school must do something. They cannot ignore it. But, not everything is true. Sometimes, students say funny things. The school must decide if it is serious. If someone worries about a student, the school can check their internet. If the student does something wrong, the school can act. But, the student can also hide their internet life. If the school does not want to check, they should not. If someone tells the school about something serious, they must act. But, teachers should not be friends on social network sites. It is not fair to students. I do not want to know what my residents do on the internet. I do not want to be their friend on social network sites. That is not my job.

Long war is not good. Start was fine. Goal was to help democracy. But lost purpose now. Not good. Maybe reason was personal. Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Such personal matters not fair. Many months passed. Purpose not clear anymore. Just war for war. Need end. Other issues important. Money spent on war could help here.

I have a question about something. I want to know if you can explain it.

Can I ask a question? It is about something that happened. Someone went online and found something bad. That person stopped it before it happened.

Is that okay? No, I don't think it is an invasion of privacy. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be a member to see someone’s profile. You have to accept them as a friend.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. But if I think something bad could happen, it is good that someone saw it. It stopped something bad from happening.

Is it bad to look at other people's profiles? It is not good to look at everyone's profiles. It is not right to discriminating against people. But if someone is looking for bad things, then it is okay.

I don't have a Myspace. I have a Facebook. I don't like that people can see my information. I saw something on TV about a man who talked to a girl on the internet and met her in less than a minute. I don't think it is safe. Sometimes people in my classes ask me to chat with them, and I don't know who they are. They know my interests, where I am during the day, and my friends. It is hard to know who can see my information. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to communicate with my friends. It is a tricky issue.

I heard my roommate talking about her high school. They banned students from having Myspace. I don't understand why the school can tell students they can't have a Myspace. I don't think it is right.

I have a question about the Iraq War. I feel like it's not good to talk about it. Many people say they were against it right from the start. But it's difficult to say now because everyone believes it was a bad idea. The Iraq War has been a disaster since we started.

People in the United States, Iraq, and other countries think it was a mistake. About 80% of Iraqis and U.S. soldiers think it was a bad idea. Many people in the United States want us to leave. I think the Iraq War is a big mistake.

The Middle East is different from the United States. It's hard to bring democracy there. We should not stay in Iraq just because we want to. If we stay, it will be like quicksand. We should leave now. Some people think we should leave gradually, but even then, it's hard to find a good reason to stay.

The people in Iraq want us to leave. About 80% of them think we should leave now. They know better than us. If we leave, we will be good guys. It's better for us to leave now than to stay where we are.

Yes, I feel gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects people in different ways.
For example, women often have a hard time getting jobs because of society's past.
People might not elect a woman to a position just because she is a woman.
Men also face problems.
For instance, it is not common for men to stay at home and take care of children.
Society may think the man should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, people sometimes do not take men seriously.
They might think the man does not understand fashion well.
This happens because men usually have different lifestyles.
In different fields, it is clear that gender discrimination exists.
It is hard to change because society's thoughts are set.
But things are changing slowly.
People are accepting more women in high positions and as stay-at-home fathers.
It takes time for society to change its mindset.

In some places, they no longer punish people for having marijuana. They make it a fine instead of a criminal offense. This does not mean the problems go away. Some people still worry about job interviews. But it costs a lot of money to arrest, book, and bring people to court. Some cities think it is better to make it a fine. They can spend this money on schools and programs for old people and homeless people. But not every city thinks this is a good idea. Some people do not want marijuana to be everywhere. They think it is better to keep it hidden. But some people think it is fine to keep it hidden. They think it is like alcohol. It is not good to drive while using it. It can affect people's lives in different ways. Some people can exercise self-control, but others cannot. It is hard to say if one substance is worse than the other.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are very traditional. They have done the same things for a long time. It's good to have roots in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible and change when needed.

A lot of Catholics attend Church every week. They follow the rules very strictly. Sometimes, they don't accept people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people of other religions, like my dad who was an Episcopalian. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because of this.

I don't think this would change things. Allowing priests to marry might not prevent pedophilic behavior. It's a different kind of issue. People who molest children probably do it regardless of whether they are married. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't prevent these things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about the issue of same-sex marriage. It is a difficult topic. It is close to the separation of church and state, and it is hard to define marriage without upsetting people. I believe that civil unions are fine. I think that people should not get government tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married in a religious way. If someone is married, they should be treated as a civil union, because that is what it is. Two people united together.

If all states can agree on how same-sex marriage should be handled, they should make it a federal law. However, I do not think that the constitution should be changed to ban same-sex marriage. It is not a big enough issue to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family, so I think about homosexuality differently. I have many gay friends, but I don't agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I don't think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic. Democratic states often support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. I think it's okay to agree with their decision. I believe homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I support legalizing gay marriage based on each state's decision. I don't think the president should decide for everyone. Bush doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state should run. He will be out of office soon, and a Democratic president might lift the ban. It's better for each state to decide. They will deal with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't believe that.
Let's see,
If you look at the definition,
Myspace is a public place.
People post things for others to see.
If you post on the internet,
You must realize that many people, including school officials, will see it.
Whether it's under a school name or not, they can still access it from their homes.
But if it helps prevent something like a school shooting,
I think it's okay.
If they check social media to make sure students are safe,
That's fine.
But if they only do it to catch students in trouble,
That's an invasion of privacy.
I think school officials should only check if it's necessary to make the school safer.
If they find something related to safety,
It's okay.
But if they just check to find trouble,
That's not okay.
I think they should be careful how they use the information they find.
I don't think it should be an invasion of privacy.
If you post something online, it's there forever.
If someone finds it later, you could get into trouble.
You should be careful what you post.
A student shouldn't assume that if they don't get in trouble right away, they won't get in trouble later.
Schools should only check social media if they have a good reason.
They should not just check to find trouble.
They should only check if they suspect something might happen.
They should not check randomly.
School officials should be careful and only check if they have a good reason.

I was upset by the attack. I wanted to fight back. But, I was not happy with how the war started. I think we did not plan well. I think we were too emotional. I think we went to war without a good plan. I think it did not work. I think we should leave. They are fighting with each other. They cannot fight with us. I think they want us to leave. I think we should go. We should not stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves. The war is not going well. I do not think we can make progress. We should leave.

The Catholic Church needs to change some things. It has been losing people because it is not very accepting.
They have strong views on things like same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
Some people do not agree with these views. They think the Church should consider new ideas.
The Church is against abortion. If you believe in it, you might not feel comfortable.
The same is true for same-sex marriage. If you believe in it, you might not feel right in a Church that does not agree.
I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests.
But I do not think these changes would have stopped people from leaving.
Many people like the idea of priests being married. It would be like their job and family life.

I think people are born gay, not choose it. So, I agree with same-sex marriage. I do not believe the federal government should interfere. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is about people's personal lives. I think the government should not make rules about this. It is wrong to punish people for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to traditional families.
But it is different.
There are many aspects to it.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Heads will not be tails.
But it is the same thing.
And there are many civil rights connected with it, like property taxes and health care.
If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be with you if you are sick.
They cannot visit you.
Because they are not legally your family.
I think this is silly if you are going to spend your life with someone.
Many scientific studies show that homosexual couples are just as successful as heterosexual couples.
It is just a relationship.
It is the same thing.
And many people get hung up on things like church involvement.
Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church.
They are asking for a marriage certificate.
If there is no church involvement, this should not be a problem.
I cannot understand why Catholics get hung up on this.
In a legal sense, if you are allowed a civil union, why not a marriage?
It is like segregation: separate but unequal.
They are the same in many ways, like relationships and community involvement.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will adjust to society.
But again, it is hard to know for sure.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
I think the amendment should say the opposite.
But President Bush has strong views on this.
He believes it goes with his views on abortion and stem cell research.
Most reasons I hear are moral reasons.
Morality differs from person to person.
To embrace one group's morality while ignoring others is unethical.
To make a law based on religious beliefs is hypocritical, considering recent controversies.
Many people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are damaged.
This is not true, according to the American Psychological Association.
People should listen to real research, not just popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal but have beneficial properties. I think it is not good to keep them away from people. I think it is okay to use them for medicine.

There are many illegal drugs that we use in pharmacies. Like oxycodone, vicodin, and perocet. These are controlled substances, but they help people. So we should not deny the good things because of a taboo around marijuana.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If people abuse alcohol, it can lead to bad things. But marijuana is less harmful than heroine or cocaine.

I think we should first remove the bad image people have of marijuana. Then people might use it responsibly. And we can make it legal gradually, not all at once.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday in a cute little dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that lasts only thirty minutes. People dress more casually, especially during summer when people come in beach clothes. Even during morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. The church I know does not involve much politics. I think these changes do not affect the accusations against Catholic priests. I do not think the church could have stopped these issues. Even if priests could marry, some men have pedophilia because of genetics, not because they are married or not married. I think the church could have done more to prevent cover-ups. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Many people were upset after September 11th. Some felt that the Iraq war was a mistake. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true. This made people angry. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. This was like a crime. Colin Powell, who was a helper to the president, later said he was not sure about the evidence he gave to the United Nations. This made people very angry. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. Some people think they wanted to get more oil. The war has been going on a long time. Withdrawing might cause more problems. Civil war might start. Some people think other countries can help. But this might not help in the long term. The Iraq government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. The country is very divided. It is hard to fix the problem.

I don't feel good about the War in Iraq. It started because we thought Iraq did something. Maybe they bombed the U.S. Maybe they were behind the 9/11 attacks. I don't know the details. I don't like it. I think we're there to create democracy and get oil. But people are upset. It's hard to help them quickly. If we leave, they'll be angry. If we stay, they might hate us more. I think it's a problem. It's hard to say if it should continue. I feel bad for Bush. He looks bad. It's like the Vietnam War. It might never end. I don't want to see kids hurt. But they have different cultures. If we stay, it might make it worse. I think it will go on for a long time.

I do not think it is right for a law to be made or for a state to make it illegal. The constitution says separation of church and state. I think this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. It is clear in the constitution that churches should make the rules for themselves. Trying to make a law for this would go against the constitution. This is not the first time this has happened, and it will not be the last. I do not believe the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. This is a personal belief issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because he is a Catholic and wants it to be against his personal beliefs. It is not a good idea to make a law for this issue because it could affect the economy or society in a bad way.

The war in Iraq. Many people think the government did not tell the truth about why they wanted to invade Iraq. They said it was to stop terrorists connected to the attacks of September 11th, but this was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about 9/11 and start the war in 2003.

I am against war. Especially when it is a surprise attack. The government should have learned from the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died there, and the government was not ready for what happened after removing the government.

The government should have planned for all possible results. They did not. Many American soldiers are still dying, and the Iraqis need help to run their country. It is hard to make a new government. It took a long time in our own country.

In the election, I thought George Bush should finish what he started. But many American soldiers are dying. We need to think about when is enough enough. Why only Iraq? It might be about oil.

Let's hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I believe it is a personal choice. People should not be denied rights because of their biological makeup. It is unfair and inhumane. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage. I think politics and government should not interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live just like any other family. They are not married because they are not allowed to be. I think it is ridiculous that Bush wants to interpret marriage his own way. I believe that being gay is often biological, not sociological. People are born this way, not because of their upbringing. I think if a couple wants to marry, it should be a private, not public, matter.

When you put things on the internet, they can be seen by anyone. It is a public place. As an R.A., I have dealt with this. When someone posts about dangerous things, the school must do something. They cannot ignore it. But, not everything is true. Sometimes, students say funny things. The school must decide if it is serious. If someone worries about a student, the school can check their internet. If the student does something wrong, the school can act. But, the student can also hide their internet life. If the school does not want to check, they should not. If someone tells the school about something serious, they must act. But, teachers should not be friends on social network sites. It is not fair to students. I do not want to know what my residents do on the internet. I do not want to be their friend on social network sites. That is not my job.

Long war is not good. Start was fine. Goal was to help democracy. But lost purpose now. Not good. Maybe reason was personal. Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Such personal matters not fair. Many months passed. Purpose not clear anymore. Just war for war. Need end. Other issues important. Money spent on war could help here.

I have a question about something. I want to know if you can explain it.

Can I ask a question? It is about something that happened. Someone went online and found something bad. That person stopped it before it happened.

Is that okay? No, I don't think it is an invasion of privacy. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be a member to see someone’s profile. You have to accept them as a friend.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. But if I think something bad could happen, it is good that someone saw it. It stopped something bad from happening.

Is it bad to look at other people's profiles? It is not good to look at everyone's profiles. It is not right to discriminating against people. But if someone is looking for bad things, then it is okay.

I don't have a Myspace. I have a Facebook. I don't like that people can see my information. I saw something on TV about a man who talked to a girl on the internet and met her in less than a minute. I don't think it is safe. Sometimes people in my classes ask me to chat with them, and I don't know who they are. They know my interests, where I am during the day, and my friends. It is hard to know who can see my information. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to communicate with my friends. It is a tricky issue.

I heard my roommate talking about her high school. They banned students from having Myspace. I don't understand why the school can tell students they can't have a Myspace. I don't think it is right.

I have a question about the Iraq War. I feel like it's not good to talk about it. Many people say they were against it right from the start. But it's difficult to say now because everyone believes it was a bad idea. The Iraq War has been a disaster since we started.

People in the United States, Iraq, and other countries think it was a mistake. About 80% of Iraqis and U.S. soldiers think it was a bad idea. Many people in the United States want us to leave. I think the Iraq War is a big mistake.

The Middle East is different from the United States. It's hard to bring democracy there. We should not stay in Iraq just because we want to. If we stay, it will be like quicksand. We should leave now. Some people think we should leave gradually, but even then, it's hard to find a good reason to stay.

The people in Iraq want us to leave. About 80% of them think we should leave now. They know better than us. If we leave, we will be good guys. It's better for us to leave now than to stay where we are.

Yes, I feel gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects people in different ways.
For example, women often have a hard time getting jobs because of society's past.
People might not elect a woman to a position just because she is a woman.
Men also face problems.
For instance, it is not common for men to stay at home and take care of children.
Society may think the man should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, people sometimes do not take men seriously.
They might think the man does not understand fashion well.
This happens because men usually have different lifestyles.
In different fields, it is clear that gender discrimination exists.
It is hard to change because society's thoughts are set.
But things are changing slowly.
People are accepting more women in high positions and as stay-at-home fathers.
It takes time for society to change its mindset.

In some places, they no longer punish people for having marijuana. They make it a fine instead of a criminal offense. This does not mean the problems go away. Some people still worry about job interviews. But it costs a lot of money to arrest, book, and bring people to court. Some cities think it is better to make it a fine. They can spend this money on schools and programs for old people and homeless people. But not every city thinks this is a good idea. Some people do not want marijuana to be everywhere. They think it is better to keep it hidden. But some people think it is fine to keep it hidden. They think it is like alcohol. It is not good to drive while using it. It can affect people's lives in different ways. Some people can exercise self-control, but others cannot. It is hard to say if one substance is worse than the other.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are very traditional. They have done the same things for a long time. It's good to have roots in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible and change when needed.

A lot of Catholics attend Church every week. They follow the rules very strictly. Sometimes, they don't accept people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people of other religions, like my dad who was an Episcopalian. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because of this.

I don't think this would change things. Allowing priests to marry might not prevent pedophilic behavior. It's a different kind of issue. People who molest children probably do it regardless of whether they are married. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't prevent these things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about the issue of same-sex marriage. It is a difficult topic. It is close to the separation of church and state, and it is hard to define marriage without upsetting people. I believe that civil unions are fine. I think that people should not get government tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married in a religious way. If someone is married, they should be treated as a civil union, because that is what it is. Two people united together.

If all states can agree on how same-sex marriage should be handled, they should make it a federal law. However, I do not think that the constitution should be changed to ban same-sex marriage. It is not a big enough issue to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family, so I think about homosexuality differently. I have many gay friends, but I don't agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I don't think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic. Democratic states often support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. I think it's okay to agree with their decision. I believe homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I support legalizing gay marriage based on each state's decision. I don't think the president should decide for everyone. Bush doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state should run. He will be out of office soon, and a Democratic president might lift the ban. It's better for each state to decide. They will deal with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't believe that.
Let's see,
If you look at the definition,
Myspace is a public place.
People post things for others to see.
If you post on the internet,
You must realize that many people, including school officials, will see it.
Whether it's under a school name or not, they can still access it from their homes.
But if it helps prevent something like a school shooting,
I think it's okay.
If they check social media to make sure students are safe,
That's fine.
But if they only do it to catch students in trouble,
That's an invasion of privacy.
I think school officials should only check if it's necessary to make the school safer.
If they find something related to safety,
It's okay.
But if they just check to find trouble,
That's not okay.
I think they should be careful how they use the information they find.
I don't think it should be an invasion of privacy.
If you post something online, it's there forever.
If someone finds it later, you could get into trouble.
You should be careful what you post.
A student shouldn't assume that if they don't get in trouble right away, they won't get in trouble later.
Schools should only check social media if they have a good reason.
They should not just check to find trouble.
They should only check if they suspect something might happen.
They should not check randomly.
School officials should be careful and only check if they have a good reason.

I was upset by the attack. I wanted to fight back. But, I was not happy with how the war started. I think we did not plan well. I think we were too emotional. I think we went to war without a good plan. I think it did not work. I think we should leave. They are fighting with each other. They cannot fight with us. I think they want us to leave. I think we should go. We should not stay there forever. We are hurting ourselves. The war is not going well. I do not think we can make progress. We should leave.

The Catholic Church needs to change some things. It has been losing people because it is not very accepting.
They have strong views on things like same-sex marriage, abortion, and birth control.
Some people do not agree with these views. They think the Church should consider new ideas.
The Church is against abortion. If you believe in it, you might not feel comfortable.
The same is true for same-sex marriage. If you believe in it, you might not feel right in a Church that does not agree.
I do not see a reason why priests cannot be married or have female priests.
But I do not think these changes would have stopped people from leaving.
Many people like the idea of priests being married. It would be like their job and family life.

I think people are born gay, not choose it. So, I agree with same-sex marriage. I do not believe the federal government should interfere. It is not a legal or moral issue. It is about people's personal lives. I think the government should not make rules about this. It is wrong to punish people for being gay.

I think that gay marriage should be legal.
Because there is no good reason not to.
Many people think that homosexual couples are a threat to traditional families.
But it is different.
There are many aspects to it.
It is like two sides of the same coin.
Heads will not be tails.
But it is the same thing.
And there are many civil rights connected with it, like property taxes and health care.
If you are in a gay couple, your partner cannot be with you if you are sick.
They cannot visit you.
Because they are not legally your family.
I think this is silly if you are going to spend your life with someone.
Many scientific studies show that homosexual couples are just as successful as heterosexual couples.
It is just a relationship.
It is the same thing.
And many people get hung up on things like church involvement.
Homosexuals are not asking to get married in a church.
They are asking for a marriage certificate.
If there is no church involvement, this should not be a problem.
I cannot understand why Catholics get hung up on this.
In a legal sense, if you are allowed a civil union, why not a marriage?
It is like segregation: separate but unequal.
They are the same in many ways, like relationships and community involvement.
People worry about adoption and how children of gay couples will adjust to society.
But again, it is hard to know for sure.
I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state.
I think the amendment should say the opposite.
But President Bush has strong views on this.
He believes it goes with his views on abortion and stem cell research.
Most reasons I hear are moral reasons.
Morality differs from person to person.
To embrace one group's morality while ignoring others is unethical.
To make a law based on religious beliefs is hypocritical, considering recent controversies.
Many people are against gay marriage because they believe gay people are damaged.
This is not true, according to the American Psychological Association.
People should listen to real research, not just popular opinion.

I work in a hospital pharmacy during the summer. Some drugs are illegal but have beneficial properties. I think it is not good to keep them away from people. I think it is okay to use them for medicine.

There are many illegal drugs that we use in pharmacies. Like oxycodone, vicodin, and perocet. These are controlled substances, but they help people. So we should not deny the good things because of a taboo around marijuana.

I do not think marijuana is like alcohol. If people abuse alcohol, it can lead to bad things. But marijuana is less harmful than heroine or cocaine.

I think we should first remove the bad image people have of marijuana. Then people might use it responsibly. And we can make it legal gradually, not all at once.

I think the church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was younger, I went to church every Sunday in a cute little dress, matching shoes, and a purse. Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that lasts only thirty minutes. People dress more casually, especially during summer when people come in beach clothes. Even during morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis. The church I know does not involve much politics. I think these changes do not affect the accusations against Catholic priests. I do not think the church could have stopped these issues. Even if priests could marry, some men have pedophilia because of genetics, not because they are married or not married. I think the church could have done more to prevent cover-ups. I do not have other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

Many people were upset after September 11th. Some felt that the Iraq war was a mistake. The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. But this was not true. This made people angry. The Bush administration did not tell the truth about Iraq. This was like a crime. Colin Powell, who was a helper to the president, later said he was not sure about the evidence he gave to the United Nations. This made people very angry. The Bush administration did not care about the constitution. They wanted to go to war. Some people think they wanted to get more oil. The war has been going on a long time. Withdrawing might cause more problems. Civil war might start. Some people think other countries can help. But this might not help in the long term. The Iraq government is not strong. The Parliament is not working well. The country is very divided. It is hard to fix the problem.

I don't feel good about the War in Iraq. It started because we thought Iraq did something. Maybe they bombed the U.S. Maybe they were behind the 9/11 attacks. I don't know the details. I don't like it. I think we're there to create democracy and get oil. But people are upset. It's hard to help them quickly. If we leave, they'll be angry. If we stay, they might hate us more. I think it's a problem. It's hard to say if it should continue. I feel bad for Bush. He looks bad. It's like the Vietnam War. It might never end. I don't want to see kids hurt. But they have different cultures. If we stay, it might make it worse. I think it will go on for a long time.

I do not think it is right for a law to be made or for a state to make it illegal. The constitution says separation of church and state. I think this issue should be decided by the churches, not the government. It is clear in the constitution that churches should make the rules for themselves. Trying to make a law for this would go against the constitution. This is not the first time this has happened, and it will not be the last. I do not believe the federal government or any government should be involved in this issue. This is a personal belief issue. The president is pushing for this amendment because he is a Catholic and wants it to be against his personal beliefs. It is not a good idea to make a law for this issue because it could affect the economy or society in a bad way.

The war in Iraq. Many people think the government did not tell the truth about why they wanted to invade Iraq. They said it was to stop terrorists connected to the attacks of September 11th, but this was not true. The government wanted to make people angry about 9/11 and start the war in 2003.

I am against war. Especially when it is a surprise attack. The government should have learned from the Vietnam War. Many American soldiers died there, and the government was not ready for what happened after removing the government.

The government should have planned for all possible results. They did not. Many American soldiers are still dying, and the Iraqis need help to run their country. It is hard to make a new government. It took a long time in our own country.

In the election, I thought George Bush should finish what he started. But many American soldiers are dying. We need to think about when is enough enough. Why only Iraq? It might be about oil.

Let's hope the war ends soon. But probably not.

I support gay marriage. I believe it is a personal choice. People should not be denied rights because of their biological makeup. It is unfair and inhumane. I have always been an advocate for gay marriage. I think politics and government should not interfere with personal choices. It is a private matter, not a public one. In my neighborhood, there are gay couples who live just like any other family. They are not married because they are not allowed to be. I think it is ridiculous that Bush wants to interpret marriage his own way. I believe that being gay is often biological, not sociological. People are born this way, not because of their upbringing. I think if a couple wants to marry, it should be a private, not public, matter.

When you put things on the internet, they can be seen by anyone. It is a public place. As an R.A., I have dealt with this. When someone posts about dangerous things, the school must do something. They cannot ignore it. But, not everything is true. Sometimes, students say funny things. The school must decide if it is serious. If someone worries about a student, the school can check their internet. If the student does something wrong, the school can act. But, the student can also hide their internet life. If the school does not want to check, they should not. If someone tells the school about something serious, they must act. But, teachers should not be friends on social network sites. It is not fair to students. I do not want to know what my residents do on the internet. I do not want to be their friend on social network sites. That is not my job.

Long war is not good. Start was fine. Goal was to help democracy. But lost purpose now. Not good. Maybe reason was personal. Bush’s father had problems with Saddam Hussein. Such personal matters not fair. Many months passed. Purpose not clear anymore. Just war for war. Need end. Other issues important. Money spent on war could help here.

I have a question about something. I want to know if you can explain it.

Can I ask a question? It is about something that happened. Someone went online and found something bad. That person stopped it before it happened.

Is that okay? No, I don't think it is an invasion of privacy. If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. On Myspace, you must be a member to see someone’s profile. You have to accept them as a friend.

If you put information on the internet, many people can see it. But if I think something bad could happen, it is good that someone saw it. It stopped something bad from happening.

Is it bad to look at other people's profiles? It is not good to look at everyone's profiles. It is not right to discriminating against people. But if someone is looking for bad things, then it is okay.

I don't have a Myspace. I have a Facebook. I don't like that people can see my information. I saw something on TV about a man who talked to a girl on the internet and met her in less than a minute. I don't think it is safe. Sometimes people in my classes ask me to chat with them, and I don't know who they are. They know my interests, where I am during the day, and my friends. It is hard to know who can see my information. I try to limit what I put up, but I also want to communicate with my friends. It is a tricky issue.

I heard my roommate talking about her high school. They banned students from having Myspace. I don't understand why the school can tell students they can't have a Myspace. I don't think it is right.

I have a question about the Iraq War. I feel like it's not good to talk about it. Many people say they were against it right from the start. But it's difficult to say now because everyone believes it was a bad idea. The Iraq War has been a disaster since we started.

People in the United States, Iraq, and other countries think it was a mistake. About 80% of Iraqis and U.S. soldiers think it was a bad idea. Many people in the United States want us to leave. I think the Iraq War is a big mistake.

The Middle East is different from the United States. It's hard to bring democracy there. We should not stay in Iraq just because we want to. If we stay, it will be like quicksand. We should leave now. Some people think we should leave gradually, but even then, it's hard to find a good reason to stay.

The people in Iraq want us to leave. About 80% of them think we should leave now. They know better than us. If we leave, we will be good guys. It's better for us to leave now than to stay where we are.

Yes, I feel gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States.
It affects people in different ways.
For example, women often have a hard time getting jobs because of society's past.
People might not elect a woman to a position just because she is a woman.
Men also face problems.
For instance, it is not common for men to stay at home and take care of children.
Society may think the man should work and make money.
In the fashion industry, people sometimes do not take men seriously.
They might think the man does not understand fashion well.
This happens because men usually have different lifestyles.
In different fields, it is clear that gender discrimination exists.
It is hard to change because society's thoughts are set.
But things are changing slowly.
People are accepting more women in high positions and as stay-at-home fathers.
It takes time for society to change its mindset.

In some places, they no longer punish people for having marijuana. They make it a fine instead of a criminal offense. This does not mean the problems go away. Some people still worry about job interviews. But it costs a lot of money to arrest, book, and bring people to court. Some cities think it is better to make it a fine. They can spend this money on schools and programs for old people and homeless people. But not every city thinks this is a good idea. Some people do not want marijuana to be everywhere. They think it is better to keep it hidden. But some people think it is fine to keep it hidden. They think it is like alcohol. It is not good to drive while using it. It can affect people's lives in different ways. Some people can exercise self-control, but others cannot. It is hard to say if one substance is worse than the other.

I would say yes.
Many things they do are very traditional. They have done the same things for a long time. It's good to have roots in tradition. But it's also important to be flexible and change when needed.

A lot of Catholics attend Church every week. They follow the rules very strictly. Sometimes, they don't accept people who don't follow the rules perfectly. They don't accept people of other religions, like my dad who was an Episcopalian. My parents couldn't marry in the Catholic Church because of this.

I don't think this would change things. Allowing priests to marry might not prevent pedophilic behavior. It's a different kind of issue. People who molest children probably do it regardless of whether they are married. I think allowing priests to marry wouldn't prevent these things from happening.

I am not sure what to think about the issue of same-sex marriage. It is a difficult topic. It is close to the separation of church and state, and it is hard to define marriage without upsetting people. I believe that civil unions are fine. I think that people should not get government tax breaks or special treatment just because they are married in a religious way. If someone is married, they should be treated as a civil union, because that is what it is. Two people united together.

If all states can agree on how same-sex marriage should be handled, they should make it a federal law. However, I do not think that the constitution should be changed to ban same-sex marriage. It is not a big enough issue to amend the constitution.

I grew up in a Christian family, so I think about homosexuality differently. I have many gay friends, but I don't agree with their lifestyle. However, I believe it should be legal. I don't think it should be a national issue. Instead, each state should decide on its own. Many states are Democratic. Democratic states often support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how they feel. I think it's okay to agree with their decision. I believe homosexuals should have the same opportunities as heterosexuals. Therefore, I support legalizing gay marriage based on each state's decision. I don't think the president should decide for everyone. Bush doesn't live in every state, so he shouldn't decide how each state should run. He will be out of office soon, and a Democratic president might lift the ban. It's better for each state to decide. They will deal with the decision, not the president.

No, I don't believe that.
Let's see,
If you look at the definition,
Myspace is a public place.
People post things for others to see.
If you post on the internet,
You must realize that many people, including school officials, will see it.
Whether it's under a school name or not, they can still access it from their homes.
But if it helps prevent something like a school shooting,
I think it's okay.
If they check social media to make sure students are safe,
That's fine.
But if they only do it to catch students in trouble,
That's an invasion of privacy.
I think school officials should only check if it's necessary to make the school safer.
If they find something related to safety,
It's okay.
But if they just check to find trouble,
That's not okay.
I think they should be careful how they use the information they find.
I don't think it should be an invasion of privacy.
If you post something online, it's there forever.
If someone finds it later, you could get into trouble.
You should be careful what you post.
A student shouldn't assume that if they don't get in trouble right away, they won't get in trouble later.
Schools should only check social media if they have a good reason.
They should not just check to find trouble.
They should only check if they suspect something might happen.
They should not check randomly.
School officials should be careful and only check if they have a good reason.
